poem:
Title: "Ode to The Critic's Reflection"

In Ypsilanti's motel haze,
Lamott, adorned in sparkling glaze,
Held court with the Abyss's maw,
Lessons wrapped in dread and awe.
Embraced by scorn's reveille,
From the harshest review, a reverie,
Where true courage coincides,
With pink shimmer on her scribes.
Thus teaches Anne, our phoenix star,
From every abyss, we draw who we are.
